contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} {{coord|48|45|15|N|10|20|4|E|display=title}} {{Infobox Military Conflict |conflict=Battle of Neresheim |partof=the [[French Revolutionary War]] |campaign= |lat_deg = 48 |lat_min = 45 |lat_sec = 15 |lon_deg = 10 |lon_min = 20 |lon_sec = 04 |image= |caption= |date=11 August 1796 |place=[[Neresheim]], [[Duchy of WÃ¼rttemberg]] |result=French victory; the Austrians retreat further into Bavaria |combatant1={{flagicon|France}} [[First French Republic|French Republic]] |combatant2={{flag|Holy Roman Empire}} [[Habsburg Austria]] |commander1=[[Jean Victor Marie Moreau]] |commander2={{flagicon|Holy Roman Empire}}[[Archduke Charles, Duke of Teschen|Archduke Charles]] |strength1=50,000 |strength2=20,000 |casualties1=2,400 |casualties2=1,600 }} {{Campaignbox First Coalition}} The '''Battle of Neresheim''' was fought on 11 August 1796 and resulted the victory of French under General Moreau against Austrians under Archduke Charles. The Austrians had originally planned to draw Moreau's eastwards into a trap, where they would surrounded and overwhelmed . However, because of poor coordination and disagreement between the Austrian commanders, only a small force of Austrians were in position to engage the French when they arrived. The defeat forced the Austrians to withdraw further into [[Electorate of Bavaria|Bavaria]]. ==References== *Pope, Stephen. ''The Cassell Dictionary of the Napoleonic Wars'', Cassell (1999) {{DEFAULTSORT:Neresheim}} [[Category:Conflicts in 1796]] [[Category:Battles of the French Revolutionary Wars]] [[Category:Battles involving Austria]] [[Category:Battles involving France]] [[Category:1796 in Austria]] [[Category:1796 in France]] [[Category:Battles of the War of the First Coalition]] [[Category:War of the First Coalition]] {{Napoleonic-battle-stub}}
